===JQuery Notifier Plugin (Growl like) as Wicket behavior example===

*[http://www.erichynds.com/jquery/a-jquery-ui-growl-ubuntu-notification-widget/ Original javascript version can be found here]*

*Prerequisites:* Your wicket application is configured to use JQWicket as described in the [http://code.google.com/p/jqwicket "Quick Start"] guide. Additionaly to the jquery core library you have to add "jquery ui" to the JQWicket's config.

*Description:* This example demonstrates how to integrate JQuery Notifier Plugin with the wicket components using JQWicket.

http://jqwicket.googlecode.com/svn-history/r233/wiki/notifier_example.png

*Java-Code:*
{{{
final NotifierWebMarkupContainer notifier = new NotifierWebMarkupContainer("notifier1");
add(notifier);
add(new AjaxLink<Void>("notifier.open1") {
   @Override
   public void onClick(AjaxRequestTarget target) {
      notifier.create(
         target,
         "Test Notification",
         "This is an example of the default config, and will fade out after five seconds.");
   }
});
}}}

*Html-Template:*
{{{
<a wicket:id="notifier.open1">open notifier</a><br/>
<div wicket:id="notifier1">
    <div id="basic-template">
        <a class="ui-notify-cross ui-notify-close" href="#">x</a>
        <h1>#{title}</h1>
        <p>#{text}</p>
    </div>
</div>
}}}
